bug.author: LuQQiu
bug.summary: Alluxio CLI doesn't show right mount info (readonly/shared)
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: Tested in both branch-2.1 and master branch Describe the bug CLI doesn't show right mount info (readonly/shared) Start alluxio with <denchmark-code>alluxio.master.mount.table.root.ufs=${alluxio.work.dir}/underFSStorage alluxio.master.mount.table.root.readonly=true alluxio.master.mount.table.root.shared=true </denchmark-code>
but mount info shows not read-only and not shared <denchmark-code>$ ./bin/alluxio fs mount /Users/alluxio/alluxioFolder/alluxio/underFSStorage on / (local, capacity=465.72GB, used=-1B(0%), not read-only, not shared, properties={}) $ ./bin/alluxio fsadmin report ufs Alluxio under storage system information: /Users/alluxio/alluxioFolder/alluxio/underFSStorage on / (local, capacity=465.72GB, used=-1B(0%), not read-only, not shared, properties={}) </denchmark-code>
Try to delete file but find the mount point should be read-only <denchmark-code>$ ./bin/alluxio fs rm /LICENSE Failed to delete /LICENSE (Operation WRITE not allowed on ufs path /Users/alluxio/alluxioFolder/alluxio/underFSStorage/LICENSE under maintenance mode READ_ONLY) from the under file system </denchmark-code>
To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior (as minimally and precisely as possible) Expected behavior Mount should show read-only in my case Urgency Describe the impact and urgency of the bug. Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/LuQQiu>@LuQQiu</denchmark-link> Actually when creating the root mount as readonly and shared, I don't think it really takes effect. For example I started Alluxio with readonly root mount using your config properties, and then I can put files in the root mount. <denchmark-code>$bin/alluxio fs copyFromLocal ./LICENSE /LICENSE Copied file:///Users/jiachengliu/Documents/Alluxio/alluxio-jiacheng/alluxio/LICENSE to /LICENSE </denchmark-code>
Do you know if readonly works at all? If not, this is totally a different issue.

Confirmed that readonly doesn't work for root mount but seems to work for nested mount. See different behavior below. <denchmark-code>$ ./bin/alluxio fs mount --shared --readonly /readonly_folder /Users/jiachengliu/Documents/Alluxio/alluxio-jiacheng/alluxio/readonly Mounted /Users/jiachengliu/Documents/Alluxio/alluxio-jiacheng/alluxio/readonly at /readonly_folder $ bin/alluxio fs mount File system class class alluxio.client.file.BaseFileSystem /Users/jiachengliu/Documents/Alluxio/alluxio-jiacheng/alluxio/readonly on /readonly_folder (local, capacity=420.03GB, used=-1B(0%), read-only, shared, properties={}) /Users/jiachengliu/Documents/Alluxio/alluxio-jiacheng/alluxio/underFSStorage on / (local, capacity=420.03GB, used=-1B(0%), not read-only, not shared, properties={}) $ bin/alluxio fs touch /readonly_folder/aaaaa A write operation on /readonly_folder/aaaaa under a readonly mount point /readonly_folder is not allowed </denchmark-code>
Please update the title of this issue.

Readonly attribute is fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/pull/10895>#10895</denchmark-link>
Shared attribute problem is more tricky and logged in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/issues/10896>#10896</denchmark-link>
Closing this issue as we can keep track on <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/issues/10896>#10896</denchmark-link>
